text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today I've 
got another fish recipe for you that as you see

is extremely weeknight friendly it's something 
called pla neung tao jiew pla neung means to steam

and tao jiew is our version of miso so it's the Thai 
version of fermented soybean paste and that flavor

goes incredibly well with fish alright let's get 
started let's talk a fish so three things about

the fish one you can use any white mild flavored 
fish for this recipe too you can do whole fish

fish steaks like I have here or filets I do prefer 
whole or steaks because the bones actually help

keep everything moist and finally three I am using 
black cod also known as sable fish because it is

a sustainable and local species right here in BC 
and just FYI in Thailand and Miku p'jem at Mecca

alright I'm gonna season this fish just a little 
bit still than flesh itself has some flavor I've

got some soy sauce that I'm just gonna drizzle and 
just spread it spread it on the fish this is not

necessary but I find that it does help so that the 
sauce isn't the only place where there's flavor

okay so I'll let that sit and absorb and meanwhile 
let's make the sauce so let's talk about the star

of the show or the Tokyo so I've got it right here 
in the bowl so it does look kind of like a liquidy

miso that didn't get mashed quite enough and miso 
is a decent substitute you you'll need to thin it

out a little bit it's very salty with a little 
bit of acidity the Korean soybean paste will

also work again you probably need to thin it out a 
little bit the flavor isn't quite exactly the same

as me so but I find that you know what it's good 
enough I'm going to add a little bit of soy sauce

so I'm using Thai mushroom soy sauce by the same 
brand and this is the the soy sauce that I used in

basically anywhere I use soy sauce this is the one 
yes that is the same creepy baby as the yes that

one and I like to use both because I find that OTO 
alone it doesn't have the kind of complexity that

I'm going for now what we have in the bowl right 
now is very salty so I really need some sweetness

to balance it out sugar which looks like a lot 
but trust me you will need it and to thin this

all out chicken stock unsalted you can also do 
vegetable stock or just water or fish stock that's

pretty much it all right so I'm gonna finish the 
sauce on the stove now and in the meantime I've

got my steamer preheating in the back you want 
to do these things at the same time so you are

efficient so I've got just a little bit of oil in 
this pot here I'm gonna turn it on and right away

I'm going to add some garlic some chopped garlic 
and I never wait for the oil to get hot before

I add the garlic because that's how you avoid 
burning your garlic cause your oil is too hot and

I'm also gonna add lots and lots of gingers finely 
julienned ginger if you've got people in the house

who doesn't like to chew on ginger what you could 
do is make big slices and then they can pick it

out easily but I like to actually eat the ginger 
now I'm gonna let this saute for about a minute to

infuse the flavor into the oil oh so good a ginger 
and fish are like a match made in heaven so now

that the garlic is starting to brown us lightly 
I'm gonna add the sauce that we mixed earlier

I'm gonna let that come to a simmer you want 
the ginger and the garlic to infuse its flavor

into the sauce and while that's happening we're 
also gonna throw in some chillies now you don't

have to make the spicy if you're feeding kids or 
if you don't feel like eating spicy food but I

would recommend in that case adding either white 
pepper or black pepper it's just a little kick of

pepperiness alright so after has had just 1 to 2 
minutes I'm gonna turn it off throw in the white

part of my green onions and the green part I have 
saved for some final garnish and now that residual

heat was slowly infuse the green onion flavor into 
there and that is it ladies and gentlemen if you

want to give this a taste and adjust the seasoning 
now is the time to do it so we got my steamer

boiling and ready to go I forgot to mention one 
thing you might have seen it and wondered what the

heck that is I put lemon grass tops under it's my 
fish this is completely optional I have lemongrass

tops in my freezer all the time because I only 
cook with the bottom half and it adds additional

flavor but it also lifts the fish up so it heats 
more evenly all around in the steamer if you don't

have it don't worry about it okay so now the fish 
is gonna go into the steamer as is for about seven

to eight minutes for steaks if you're doing whole 
fish it's gonna take ten to fifteen depending on

the size of your fish off it goes look at that oh 
and shout out to my fan in Hawaii who sent me this

awesome Hawaiian of admits and other goodies love 
it so as you can see there's quite a bit of liquid

at the bottom of this bowl right now and I used to 
just use that as part of the sauce but I realized

that it became harder to control the seasoning of 
the fish when you don't know how much liquid is

gonna be left in there support right ah without 
without losing the fish most of it if you are

using black cod here is a tip black cod has a lot 
of pin bones inside of the fish that is impossible

to get out when it's raw but when it's cooked you 
can see them sticking up right there okay so you

want to take this time to pull them out so that 
you'll have less bone navigating to do afterwards

and it should just slide out easily if the fish is 
cooked okay oh there are still bones in there so

you want to make sure you tell your guests to wash 
four bones but for my Asian brothers and sisters

we all grew up eating fish with bones right so we 
know what to do but if you got guests who are not

used to navigating bones they've got to know so 
now the sauce goes right over that fish oh yes

there's actually enough sauce here for three 
pieces of fish but my pretty plate wasn't big

enough for three and as a final touch I am just 
going to add some green onions and red bell pepper

Julian's that I have curled in some ice and it's 
super easy you just cut you know shreds Julianne's

of green onions like this and soak them in ice 
water and they curl up look how pretty that is and

so easy so fast so healthy this is something you 
definitely want to have with rice just make sure

you got that ready oh look at that I just love how 
flaky black cod is make sure you get some sauce

on there some of that ginger I'm gonna dismantle 
it and make sure there's no bones in there first

of all words cannot describe this is one of my 
favorite flavor combination fish and both deal

its it's just the right balance of salty sweet 
tons of umami and that gingery zing man it's so

good you have to give this a try if you love fish 
you have to give this a try and it's so easy so

there really is no excuse and the recipe as always 
will be on hot Thai Kitchen calm when you make it

send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram 
and if you haven't subscribed to the show make

sure that you do so you don't miss an episode 
like this and when you do click that little bell

icon to make sure you get a notification when I 
post a new recipe and if you love the show and

you want to support us check out our patreon link 
in the description below and I will see you next

time for your next delicious Thai meal let's 
talk fish three things one what was one again
